sub_concepts.name: Linear Momentum
sub_concepts.definition: The product of the mass of an object and its velocity. It is a vector quantity and is conserved in closed systems.

sub_concepts.name: Impulse
sub_concepts.definition: The force applied to an object over a period of time, resulting in a change in its momentum. It is calculated as the integral of force over time.

sub_concepts.name: Conservation of Momentum
sub_concepts.definition: A fundamental principle of physics that states the total momentum of a closed system remains constant unless acted upon by an external force.

sub_concepts.name: Momentum Transfer
sub_concepts.definition: The process of transferring momentum from one object to another through collisions or other interactions. It is an important concept in the study of kinetics.

sub_concepts.name: Relativistic Momentum
sub_concepts.definition: A modification of the classical momentum concept to account for the effects of special relativity. It is calculated as the product of the relativistic mass and velocity of an object.
